Name: Creation of a map of trails accessible to the public in parks and natural areas under the jurisdiction of the parks dept.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a map of trails accessible to the public in parks and natural areas under the jurisdiction of the parks department

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Parks and Recreation (DPR) to post maps of trails in natural areas and parks that are accessible to the public on its website.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

      Section 1. Chapter one of title eighteen of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 18-156 to read as follows:
      � 18-156 Maps of trails in parks and natural areas. The commissioner shall make available, on the department's website, maps of each trail that is accessible for public use in each park and natural area under the jurisdiction of the department.
      �2. This local law takes effect 180 days after it becomes law.
